legalTaxOptimisation: Claim Capital Allowances: Deduct the cost of qualifying assets (e.g., machinery, vehicles, furniture) from your taxable profit over time, reducing your CIT liability.
Leverage Investment Incentives: Explore government incentives like Pioneer Status (tax holiday), Rural Investment Allowance, or tax credits for Research & Development to gain significant tax relief.
Maximise Allowable Expenses: Conduct a thorough review to ensure all legitimate business-related expenses, including donations to approved bodies and specific provisions, are fully claimed.
Utilise Loss Relief: Carry forward any business losses from previous years to offset against the current year's profit, thereby reducing your taxable income.
complianceNotes: Key Deadlines: Company Income Tax (CIT) returns are due within 6 months of your financial year-end. VAT returns and payments are due monthly, by the 21st of the following month. All business and tax records must be kept for a minimum of 6 years.
